basics.name: Chris Small
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: I've been working with C#/.NET framework since beta 2. My focus is on ASP.NET MVC with SQL Server plus client side technologies, and more recently .NET core on Docker/Linux and devops with Hashistack and AWS/VMWare.

work.summary: One of three Principal developers in the Engineering team, the team focus is on improving the legacy areas of the platform and exploring and recommending new technology to reduce the cost of change.
highlights: Technology stack: C#, .NET 1.1 to 4.6, MVC, Webforms, MSMQ, SQL Server, WebAPI/REST and WCF. Powershell, Chocolatey and Packer-based automation for AWS and VMWare.
Discussing, setting and communicating standards, improving the build and CI process to reduce the cost of change.
Consulting with, and helping scrum teams with implementations of new technology.

My starting role at Totaljobs was Senior developer, working in scrum teams to deliver features to the Jobseeker and Recruiter websites, a Salesforce-based fulfillment service and a large-scale email sending application.
Technology stack: C#, MVC, Webforms, NHibernate, Sql Server, MSMQ, Silverlight, Watin/Selenium, Unity and Postsharp.
Responsible for maintenance of existing webforms based product range, and new ASP.NET MVC 3.0 applications.
Scrum based process typically with 30 day iterations, burn downs, daily stand ups, code reviews.
My starting role at the RICS was as a mid-level developer.
LAMP and C#/SQL Server development for Screwfix and Hanson websites.
